caption.title: Power Cobbe by Herself (1894) *(IIIF Single Image, info.json)*
caption.text: Frances Power Cobbe (4 December 1822 â€“ 5 April 1904) was an Irish writer, social reformer, and suffragist. Founder of the British Union for the Abolition of Vivisection (BUAV) in 1898, and was a member of the executive council of the London National Society for Women's Suffrage. [See in the Welcome Collection](https://wellcomecollection.org/works/n5jnxrrt)

caption.title: Photograph of the Women for Life on Earth (WFLOE) Volunteers  *(static image)*
caption.text: The Peace March from Cardiff to Greenham Common, outside Cardiff City Hall, 27 August 1981. See in the [People Collection Wales](https://www.peoplescollection.wales/items/575934)

caption.title: Photograph of the Women for Life on Earth (WFLOE) Volunteers  *(static image)*
caption.text: The focus of the picture seems to be on a woman wearing an armband that reads 'steward'. She is carrying a lot of baggage with her, presumably with the necessities for the march ahead.
Cardiff (using EPSG:3857 -Web Mercator- coordinates for the extent)
If you don't provide an extent for a geographic map, it will zoom to the entire world.
